==Rationale==
==Rationale==
The rationale for censorship is different for various types of information censored:
The rationale for censorship is different for various types of information censored:
â
*'''Moral censorship''' is the removal of materials that are [[Obscenity|obscene]] or otherwise considered morally questionable. [[Pornography]], for example, is often censored under this rationale, especially [[child pornography]], which is censored in most jurisdictions in the world.
+
*'''Moral censorship''' is the removal of materials that are [[Obscenity|obscene]] or otherwise considered morally questionable. [[Pornography]], for example, is often censored under this rationale, especially [[child pornography]], which is illegal and censored censored in many jurisdictions in the world.<ref>http://www.missingkids.com/en_US/documents/CP_Legislation_Report.pdf</ref><ref>http://www.csecworldcongress.org/en/index.htm</ref>
*'''Military censorship''' is the process of keeping [[military intelligence]] and [[military tactics|tactics]] confidential and away from the enemy. This is used to counter [[espionage]], which is the process of gleaning military information. Very often, militaries will also attempt to suppress politically inconvenient information even if that information has no actual intelligence or combat-tactical value.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}}
*'''Military censorship''' is the process of keeping [[military intelligence]] and [[military tactics|tactics]] confidential and away from the enemy. This is used to counter [[espionage]], which is the process of gleaning military information. Very often, militaries will also attempt to suppress politically inconvenient information even if that information has no actual intelligence or combat-tactical value.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}}
*'''[[Political censorship]]''' occurs when governments hold back information from their citizens. This is often done to exert control over the populace and prevent free expression that might foment [[rebellion]]. Another version of censorship is the phenomenon of disinformation which uses "[[Red herring (idiom)|red herring]]s" to distract people from some other controversial issue.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}}
*'''[[Political censorship]]''' occurs when governments hold back information from their citizens. This is often done to exert control over the populace and prevent free expression that might foment [[rebellion]]. Another version of censorship is the phenomenon of disinformation which uses "[[Red herring (idiom)|red herring]]s" to distract people from some other controversial issue.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}}
